request: Lord, we ask that You would form and strengthen a true culture of discipleship among us. Let biblical preaching be clear, faithful, and transformative. Cultivate transparent, grace-filled relationships in our community. Stir in us a deep hunger for the gospel—may it be our daily bread. Help us to live lives that are distinct from the world, marked by holiness, love, and integrity. Fix our eyes on the hope of heaven, and fill us with joy even in hardship. Teach us to give joyfully and generously. Lead us to take the gospel to new places—across the street and around the world. May our work be full of good deeds that reflect Your character and draw others to You. Prepare our hearts for persecution, should it come, and give us boldness and wisdom to share the gospel this week with those You place in our path. Amen.
Andrew Omerzu, Brad and Molly Turner, Hayden and Emmalynn Sphire, Jake and Bri Rose, Joey and Sarah Koo, Clay and Natalie Winslow, Cody and Kat Pelle, Kyle Soiste, Mike and Charissa Napoles.

Lord, may I and we be a force multiplier for the gospel, our employers, and our colleagues—Joe, Hollis, Brent, Rob, John F., Samri, Ron, Jason, Wenye, David G., Michael, Russ, Jake, Tom, Karen, Brad B., Jereon, Pei—and other related teams and IT groups at W&S. Help us create a psychologically safe learning environment for all. As Colossians 3:23–24 (ESV) says, "Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ."

For the salvation of the following as a demonstration of Your mercy and favor, if not, then their lives to bring You honor: Cheryl; Josh; Dale and Lora, Dustin and Carrie, and Erin and family; Ed and Barb, Rod and Mary Dawn, and Hailey, Scott, Tyler, Alex, and Royce, Tanner and Tristan, Curt and Christy; Aunt Carol and Jerry, Bruce and Betsy, Jonathon and Jamie; Amanda, Donna, Holly, Scott, Craig, and their families; Kristi, Bobbie, Jayson, Levity, Kaylyn, Guage, and Sophya; Rusty and Tim and their families; Zach and family, Tiff and family, Timmie and family; Chris and Tim, Erin and her family; Lori and Mike, C.J. and his family; Carlee and her family; Rayder and Eli; Aunt Sharon and Eric, Tiffany and Nathan, their daughters Taylor and Ryan and their families; Kearsten and Trevor and family; Becky, Cheryl, Steve, and their families and their children's families; May God transform our fears, felt-needs, and frustrations into faith in Christ.

Lord, we lift up the three branches of the United States government and all who serve within them. For the Executive Branch, we pray for the President, the Vice President, the Cabinet, and all federal agencies—grant them wisdom, integrity, and a deep sense of accountability before You. For the Legislative Branch, we pray for members of Congress in both the House and the Senate—give them clarity, courage, and a heart to serve the public good rather than personal or partisan gain. For the Judicial Branch, we ask that judges at every level, especially the Supreme Court, would uphold justice with humility, impartiality, and fear of You. We also pray for special interest groups and the national media—that they would act with honesty, fairness, and a sincere desire to inform and not to manipulate. As Proverbs 21:1 says, "The king's heart is a stream of water in the hand of the LORD; he turns it wherever he will." May You guide their hearts according to Your perfect will.

Lord, let Your good hand be upon us. We pray for Jackie—that she would glorify You in all things and be blessed with health, safety, well-being, joy, and alignment with Your will. We lift up Seth—for his salvation and well-being, and that he would be a loving and wise father to his children. For Emily, we ask for her salvation and for grace and strength in her parenting. We pray for Harley—for salvation, health, and protection. For Timothy and Luna, along with Bill and Angie, may their relationships be strong and grounded in Your love. For John and Alyse, we ask that their goals would be shaped by Your Word. Give them wisdom, restraint, and foresight in both home and work. We lift up Oliver, Remi, and Cassidy—for salvation, health, and safety. For Sophya, we pray for her salvation, safety, and well-being at home. For our entire family, we ask for hearts that are motivated to glorify You in everything. Help us all make wise choices in what we listen to and watch. Teach us to turn our fears, needs, and frustrations into faith in the Lord Jesus.

Josh McFadden and his salvation. Dave Wernz and the efforts at GFC. Caleb Combs neurological condition. Daniel Allison and his marriage to Britney. Rachael Allen healing from cancer; Ben and Rachel Townsend and the blending of their family; Rick & Kim Bular and their daughter and her children as she is now widowed.

I come before You, confessing my heart's propensity to wander. I pray for Your Spirit to powerfully incline my heart to your testimonies, and not to selfish gain! (Psalm 119:36). Help me to value Your truth above all selfish gain. Turn my eyes from looking at worthless things; and give me life in your ways (Psalm 119:37). Empower me to find true life and joy in Your ways. 
 I pray that You would open my eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of your law (Psalm 119:18). Remove any veil from my heart and mind that prevents me from truly beholding the wondrous things in Your law. Grant me spiritual insight to grasp the depth of Your truth, that I may be amazed and transformed by Your Word. 
 O LORD, I desire to walk in Your truth. Teach me your way, O LORD, that I may walk in your truth; unite my heart to fear your name (Psalm 86:11). Purify my motives and my affections so that my entire being is singularly devoted to fearing Your holy name. May there be no division in my loyalty, but a wholehearted commitment to You alone. 
 Gracious God, I pray that You would satisfy us in the morning with your steadfast love, that we may rejoice and be glad all our days (Psalm 90:14). Let Your love be the deep well from which I draw all my contentment and joy. May this satisfaction in You empower me to rejoice and be glad in You all my days, regardless of my circumstances.

Lord, we lift up our local leaders and institutions to You. We pray for the local media—that they would report truthfully, fairly, and with integrity. For City Managers, Mayors, and Council Members, give them wisdom and a heart to serve their communities with justice and compassion. We pray for our law enforcement—for Police, Sheriffs, and Deputies—grant them courage, protection, and integrity in every decision. For the local courts throughout the tri-state cities, towns, and villages, may justice be upheld with impartiality and discernment. We lift up the County Governments of Hamilton, Clermont, Boone, Kenton, Campbell, Dearborn, and Ohio counties—guide them in truth, humility, and wise stewardship. As Daniel 2:20–22 declares: "Blessed be the name of God forever and ever, to whom belong wisdom and might. He changes times and seasons; he removes kings and sets up kings; he gives wisdom to the wise and knowledge to those who have understanding; he reveals deep and hidden things; he knows what is in the darkness, and the light dwells with him."

Lord, help me to be consistent in meaningful daily prayer. Teach me to love You more deeply, to love my wife in a way that reflects the truth and grace of Your Word, and to love the others You’ve placed in my life. Give me a heart that is willing and ready to share the Gospel with others in a way that is genuine, attractive, and rooted in Your love. Keep me from being too easily satisfied with things that do not last. Help me to value You above all else. Let me dwell on Your sovereign control over every part of my life.

I pray for the opera interns in Andrew's; Ryan and his wife; James and roommate(s); Vanoy and family; Michael Ross and Austina; Brandon and his girlfriend; Joel and Bri Schneider's tenants; Kevin downstairs on the other end; Michelle (pilot of ocean liners); inhabiting Steve and Leslie's; Kara and boyfriend; Ashley and boyfriend; Alisha and two roommates; for me to develop meaningful relationships with my neighbors; and for the HOA board to promote unity among the residents.

Lord, help me to seek You and Your kingdom first, not my own. Give me the right motivation to develop skills—life skills, biblical understanding, and professional abilities—for the sake of Your kingdom and Your glory. Grant me the ability and discipline to acquire these skills, and guide me to study in balance, aligned with Your will. As Matthew 6:33 says, "But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you."

Lord, we lift up the leaders of our states to You. We pray for Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine, and Indiana Governor Mike Braun. Grant them wisdom, humility, and a desire to serve with integrity. We also pray for their Executive Cabinet and Committee Members—guide their decisions and surround them with wise counsel. For all state legislators, we ask for discernment, courage, and a heart to uphold justice and truth. We lift up the State Courts—may their rulings reflect righteousness and impartiality. For the State Militias and all Law Enforcement personnel, we ask for strength, protection, and accountability in their service. As Daniel 2:20–22 says, "Blessed be the name of God forever and ever, to whom belong wisdom and might. He changes times and seasons; he removes kings and sets up kings; he gives wisdom to the wise and knowledge to those who have understanding; he reveals deep and hidden things; he knows what is in the darkness, and the light dwells with him."

Lord, we lift up new believers in restricted areas. Give them wisdom and courage as they share their faith. Please ensure the safe delivery of Bibles into their hands. We ask You to powerfully work through media ministries that are broadcasting Your Word across closed borders. Let these messages reach hearts and bear lasting fruit. Strengthen and protect persecuted Christians, especially those imprisoned for their faith. Surround them with Your presence and sustain their hope. Stir the hearts of believers in free nations. Help them to embrace their faith deeply and actively support their persecuted brothers and sisters with prayer, advocacy, and generosity. We pray for the transformation of government officials in hostile nations. Soften their hearts and guide them toward truth, justice, and mercy. Bless and uphold pastoral leaders working in difficult and dangerous places. Give them endurance, joy, and the resources they need. And finally, Lord, we pray for the Pashtun peoples. Open their hearts to Your truth and raise up laborers to share the Good News with them.
